byline.contributor: Josh Kron reported from Namugongo, Uganda, and Jeffrey Gettleman from Nairobi, Kenya.
byline.original: By JOSH KRON and JEFFREY GETTLEMAN

abstract: Pope Francis celebrates Mass for vast gathering of Ugandans at national shrines to Christian martyrs; does not address controversy caused by country's harsh treatment of gays, or other political issues roiling African nation, which is 85 percent Christian.
lead_paragraph: Hundreds of thousands came to see the pope at the Namugongo shrines, which are dedicated to 19th century Christian converts who were killed for refusing to renounce their beliefs.

headline.main: Pope Francis Offers Mass in Uganda at Shrine for Christian Martyrs
headline.print_headline: Huge Crowd in Uganda Hears Pope Celebrate Mass at a Shrine for Christian Martyrs

snippet: Hundreds of thousands came to see the pope at the Namugongo shrines, which are dedicated to 19th century Christian converts who were killed for refusing to renounce their beliefs.
